items.title: Machine Learning Meets Medicine: Accelerating Drug Discovery for the Future
items.author: Tufail Ahmad
items.description:
Introduction

Novel drug discovery has been increasingly known to be a costly affair, grossly time-consuming, and comes with a high risk of failure. In recent years, biotechnology has been substantially improved, but the number of drug candidates that reach clinical trials or approval is minimal. AI is all set to alter this landscape by reducing the time taken, increasing the drug discovery process's hit rates, and providing new space for personalized medicine. Carrie Arnold’s research paper titled: ‘ Inside the Nascent Industry of AI-Designed Drugs’ explores the growing use of AI in this area. This blog post discusses the potential of artificial intelligence technologies for the drug discovery process as well as their possibilities for new approaches to combating disease and neglected diseases.

Background

The traditional drug development model is well known to be long and costly. Target selection, candidate molecule proposal, preliminary work, and great clinical trials are part of the process. AI can be seen as a new paradigm for organizational innovation, as it applies machine learning and computational methods to enhance this pipeline throughout all its processes. For instance, generative AI can predict protein structure, analyze big data, and design novel compounds with higher efficiency.

Key market players including Insilico Medicine, Exscientia, and Recursion, are actively using Artificial Intelligence in drug discovery. Such companies use sophisticated AI systems to search for potential drugs, know about patients, and even forecast their reactions to medications. Such innovations are not only improving drug discovery by taking less time, and cost but also helpful in developing the first-ever treatment for the diseases with very few cure rates.

Methodology

Artificial intelligent drug discovery employs modern-day computational approaches and statistical analyses. Proteomics, genomics, and transcriptomics are important components of multi-omics studies to discover biomarkers and pathobiology. Exscientia, for instance, applies deep learning models for the design of new molecules and Insilico Medicine then applies custom AI platforms to establish new drug targets. For instance, EXS-21546, by Exscientia, owing to generative AI is a selective A2A receptor antagonist that has been taken into Phase I/II clinical trials for solid tumors. They served as templates for identifying probable responder patients to facilitate patient-tailored intervention methods. In the same way, two ground-breaking protein folding prediction architectures, called AlphaFold, and RoseTTAFold, rely on neural networks to solve intricate protein folding processes, which is essential for precision medicine.

Results

Examples of AI-designed drugs in the clinical trial phase are Exscientia’s EXS-4318 and Insilico Medicine’s INS018_055. INS018_055, focused on idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis targeted disease progressed from identification to a phase 1 trial in only two years. This quick timeline is interesting in debating the effectiveness of artificial intelligence in the fast-tracking of the drug development processes.

Other examples of accomplishments of the companies are the efforts of Recursion in finding a cure for the neurofibromatosis type 2 rare disease and the development of therapies for inflammation and autoimmunity diseases by BenevolentAI. The potential for AI to identify new molecular links and treatment outcomes has expanded chemical spaces that were uncharted by human chemists.

Discussion

In this paper, the role of AI in drug discovery will be demonstrated to be rather complex. Through machine learning algorithms, costs are low and development time is shorter because the identification of targets and design of molecules is therefore now automated. In addition, through a model that integrates multi-omics, it can develop precise medication strategies according to patient condition. The study also examines the role of AI in advancing neglected diseases — the Stanford University research group is using machine learning-based tool in Developing Innovative therapies for diseases like Dengue fever and Chagas disease for the Drugs for Neglected Diseases Institute.

Nonetheless, challenges persist even in the future though the advances are highly promising. AI-designed molecules can be new to regulation environments and the integration of these technologies to classical processes demands a lot of capital. Besides, there are other typical issues of AI; the ethical perspective of how drugs are discovered and made available to the public also must overcome challenges.

Reflection

This focus on the capabilities of AI in the context of drug discovery perfectly matched the personal academic topics I am interested in, which include bioinformatics and precision medicine. This brief trajectory of drugs such as INS018_055 from the idea stage to clinical trials is a technique that AI promotes. This research makes me want to look at how issues of global health can be solved by computational means. Future developments that I find more interesting are the potential of applying AI to increase the accessibility of the best practices in treatment.

Conclusion

AI has great potential to transform drug discovery by providing a faster, more precise, and accessible research model. The advancement examined in the research paper demonstrates how AI could revolutionize medicine. With these advancements and the growth of these technologies, new therapies for difficult and underrepresented diseases are possible, adding value to patient recourse globally.

For this blog post, I utilized ChatGPT to analyze the research paper, generate structured summaries, and draft content. Additionally, DALL-E was used to create a relevant graphic for visual enhancement.

Stanford Data Ocean provides Stanford certificate training in precision medicine without costs to anyone whose annual income is under $70,000 USD/ year. Apply for scholarship here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfi6ucNOQZwRLDjX_ZMScpkX-ct_p2i8ylP24JYoMlgR8Kz_Q/viewform

References

Arnold, C. (2023). Inside the nascent industry of AI-designed drugs. Nature Medicine, 29(6), 1292–1295. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41591-023-02361-0

AlphaFold Protein Structure Database: https://www.alphafold.ebi.ac.uk/ [Accss Date: 15 December 2024]

items.title: Soaring High: Reflections on the Final Fellowship Session
items.author: Tufail Ahmad
items.description:
True growth lies not just in acquiring knowledge, but in the connections we build and the courage we find to soar beyond our limits.

Reflecting on our last Fellowship session, “Taking Flight,” I find myself filled with nostalgia and anticipation. This session was not just a conclusion but a testament to the bonds we’ve forged and the growth we’ve experienced over the past weeks.

The Power of Connection

The most remarkable aspect of this final session was connecting and conversing without the weight of work hanging over us. Amidst the usual hustle and bustle, we often overlook the importance of such interactions. This session reminded me of the profound impact that simply talking and connecting can have on our emotional well-being.

Is it important to connect and uplift ourselves emotionally? Without a doubt. These moments of genuine connection are vital for our mental health. They provide a sense of belonging and support that rejuvenates our spirits and enhances our overall productivity and happiness.

Staying Connected with My Amal Family

Moving forward, I plan to keep in touch with my Amal family through regular virtual meet-ups, social media interactions, and group chats. These platforms will allow us to share updates, celebrate achievements, and offer support during challenging times. Maintaining these connections will ensure that the strong network we’ve built continues to thrive.

Applying Fellowship Learnings to Future Endeavors

The lessons from this Fellowship are invaluable and will guide me in every aspect of my life. The skills I’ve acquired — from effective communication to leadership — are essential tools for my future. I’ve learned the importance of resilience, the power of a supportive network, and the value of continual learning and self-improvement.

In my future career, I intend to leverage these skills to excel professionally and to create a positive and collaborative work environment. The confidence I’ve gained from organizing and participating in events, as shown in my photo from an international conference, is a testament to the personal growth facilitated by Amal Academy.

Visual Journey

I’ve included some group pictures to capture the essence of our final session. These visuals illustrate the joy, camaraderie, and sense of accomplishment we all felt. Here’s a glimpse into our memorable journey:

As we all soar high into our future endeavors, the memories and lessons from Amal Academy will always guide us. Here’s to staying connected, continuing to grow, and achieving great heights together!

items.title: Flower Mug: A Symbol of Learning
items.author: Tufail Ahmad
items.description:
The flower mug represents the beginning of my journey at Amal Academy. Every session was like a fresh start, filled with new knowledge and perspectives. Holding this mug, I felt a sense of comfort and readiness to absorb everything that was being taught.

Canteen: The Tea Breaks

After each session, I would head to the canteen for a cup of tea. This place became a sanctuary where I could relax and reflect on the day’s learning. It was also a great place to connect with fellow participants and share our thoughts and experiences.

Desk: My Workspace

This desk was my anchor during the sessions. It was where I focused, took notes, and engaged with the course material. It reminds me of the dedication and effort I put into making the most of my time at Amal Academy.

Ramadan Iftari: Community and Celebration

During Ramadan, we would gather for iftar after the sessions. These moments were not just about breaking the fast but also about building a sense of community. It was a time of sharing, gratitude, and joy.

My Experience The first two weeks at Amal Academy were transformative. Initially, I felt a mix of excitement and nervousness. However, as the days passed, I found myself more comfortable and eager to learn. The structured sessions and supportive environment helped me gain new insights and skills.

What I Learned In the first two weeks, I learned about effective communication, goal setting, and the importance of self-awareness. The sessions were interactive and practical, providing me with tools that I could immediately apply in my personal and professional life.

Self-Discovery I discovered that I am more resilient and adaptable than I thought. The challenges and new experiences pushed me out of my comfort zone, allowing me to grow and develop in unexpected ways.

items.title: A Turning Point at Amal Academy: A Journey of Growth and Self-Discovery
items.author: Tufail Ahmad
items.description:
My journey at Amal Academy over the past three months has been transformative, shaping my perspective and approach towards personal and professional growth. However, it wasn’t always smooth sailing. At the start, I was overwhelmed with academic pressures and other commitments, making me contemplate quitting the academy. A single event changed this course dramatically and had a lasting impact on me.

The Instance That Had the Most Impact

The pivotal moment came when I was on the verge of leaving Amal Academy. I felt stretched too thin, struggling to balance my studies and other responsibilities. It was then that a friend of mine intervened. Without my knowledge, they sent an email to our teacher, Sir Hasnain, explaining my situation. Sir Hasnain’s response was nothing short of inspiring. He reached out to me, offering words of encouragement and motivation, urging me to persevere. His belief in my potential was evident and his support was unwavering. This encouragement culminated in an online session where he publicly praised my progress, lifting my spirits and igniting a renewed sense of purpose within me. That day, his words filled me with courage and determination. It was a moment I will never forget.

Reflection and Self-Realization

This incident made me deeply reflect on myself and the way I perceive challenges. Initially, I saw my obstacles as insurmountable, viewing my situation through a lens of defeat. However, Sir Hasnain’s support made me realize that I was capable of more than I thought. It taught me the importance of resilience and the power of external validation in boosting one’s confidence. More importantly, it helped me understand that seeking help and leaning on others during tough times is not a sign of weakness but a step toward growth.

The Influence of Others’ Energy

The positive energy and encouragement from my friend and Sir Hasnain played a crucial role in this realization. Their actions demonstrated the impact that a supportive community can have on an individual’s mindset. My friend’s initiative to reach out on my behalf and Sir Hasnain’s subsequent encouragement showed me the importance of surrounding oneself with positive influences. Their belief in me created a ripple effect, transforming my outlook and inspiring me to strive harder.

Looking Back: What I Would Do Differently

Reflecting on this journey, I realize there are several things I would approach differently. Firstly, I would recognize the importance of communication earlier. If I had shared my struggles sooner, I might have received the support I needed without reaching a breaking point. Secondly, I would embrace challenges as opportunities for growth rather than obstacles. Lastly, I would cultivate a habit of seeking and accepting help, understanding that collaboration and support are vital components of success.

My time at Amal Academy has been a period of significant personal growth, marked by a crucial turning point that reshaped my outlook. The encouragement I received not only helped me persevere but also taught me valuable lessons about resilience, the power of community, and the importance of positive reinforcement. Moving forward, I am more confident and better equipped to face challenges, knowing that support and encouragement are always within reach.

items.title: My In-Person CV Drop at Umar Chain of Pharmacies
items.author: Tufail Ahmad
items.description:
In my quest to advance my career, I recently took a bold step and decided to deliver my CV in person to Umar Chain of Pharmacies in Peshawar. What I thought would be a straightforward task turned into a profound learning experience, offering insights that went far beyond the job application itself.

As I approached the entrance of Umar Chain of Pharmacies, I felt a mixture of excitement and anxiety. I knew my introduction had to be impactful and succinct. Summoning all my confidence, I greeted the receptionist and introduced myself, briefly outlining my qualifications and passion for the HR Officer position. This experience reinforced the importance of being able to articulate my skills and enthusiasm clearly and concisely.

The visit presented several challenges. The bustling lobby was a test of my composure, and the need to manage my time effectively while staying focused added to the complexity. Yet, these obstacles proved to be valuable opportunities for personal growth.

To navigate these challenges, I adopted a flexible mindset and maintained a positive attitude. Engaging with the receptionist with a warm smile and making eye contact helped me establish a connection and convey my professionalism and sincerity. This approach not only eased my nerves but also left a positive impression.

Reflecting on this experience, I recognize areas for improvement. In future interactions, I will invest more time in researching the company’s culture and values to better align my pitch with their ethos. Additionally, I plan to refine my elevator pitch to ensure it effectively captures my unique strengths and what I can bring to the team.

Ultimately, my visit to Umar Chain of Pharmacies was more than a job application — it was a lesson in resilience, adaptability, and the importance of making a memorable first impression. For others considering a similar approach, I recommend thorough preparation, effective communication, and viewing each challenge as an opportunity for growth.

In the professional world, every interaction offers a chance to learn and improve. My experience at Umar Chain of Pharmacies served as a powerful reminder that the journey and the lessons we learn along the way are just as significant as reaching our ultimate career goals.

items.title: A Journey of Charity and Resilience: Collecting Funds for Akhuwat Foundation
items.author: Tufail Ahmad
items.description:
Prophet Muhammad, Peace be Upon Him, said: “The believer’s shade on the Day of Resurrection will be his charity.” (Al-Tirmidhi).

Reflecting on this profound wisdom, our group embarked on a mission to collect funds for the Akhuwat Foundation, a nonprofit organization in Pakistan that provides interest-free loans to those excluded from formal financial services.

About Akhuwat Foundation

The Akhuwat Foundation, founded in 2003 by Dr. Muhammad Amjad Saqib, aims to alleviate poverty through interest-free microfinance. By empowering individuals financially, Akhuwat fosters social inclusion and economic self-sufficiency. This noble mission aligns perfectly with the spirit of charity emphasized in Islamic teachings.

Group Strategy

Our group had a clear objective: to collect a minimum of 1000 Rupees each, with a personal donation of at least 200 Rupees. Unfortunately, I couldn’t attend the initial online meeting due to urgent work commitments, but Myra Shabaz shared the instructions with the group. We were to send our contributions to Sidra Bibi, who would then transfer the total amount to the Akhuwat account.

My Contribution

Despite my initial absence, I dove headfirst into the task. Over two weeks, I collected a total of Rs1760, including my donation. I approached people in my hostel and even convinced three strangers to contribute. Here’s a reflection on my journey:

Week One: A Feeling of Content

As I reached out to people, I was amazed at how persuasive I could be. I explained the mission of the Akhuwat Foundation and the impact their donations would have. To my delight, many agreed to donate and shared their donation screenshots with me. Collecting over one thousand rupees felt like a significant achievement, filling me with a sense of contentment and fulfillment. I learned that even small efforts can make a difference and that people are willing to support a good cause when they understand its importance.
The first week taught me that initiating conversations about charity is not as daunting as it seems. People are inherently generous and supportive when approached with sincerity and a clear purpose.

Week Two: Silence

In the second week, I expanded my efforts by involving friends and visiting classes in my department. Despite receiving a positive response, the funds collected did not meet my expectations. This contrast was stark compared to the previous week’s success, and it tested my patience and perseverance.
The second week was a humbling experience, reminding me that not every effort yields immediate results. It highlighted the importance of consistency and the need to stay motivated, even when faced with slower progress.

Challenges and Resilience

Throughout this journey, I encountered numerous challenges — from rejections and apathy to time constraints and logistical issues. However, each setback only strengthened my resolve. I learned to adapt, innovate, and find creative solutions to keep pushing forward.

This experience has been instrumental in building my resilience. It taught me the importance of perseverance and the power of resilience in achieving goals. Every obstacle became a stepping stone, reinforcing my belief in the cause and my determination to succeed.

We were to send our contributions to Sidra Bibi, who would then transfer the total amount to the Akhuwat account.

My Contribution

Despite my initial absence, I dove headfirst into the task. Over two weeks, I collected a total of Rs1760, including my donation. I approached people in my hostel and even convinced three strangers to contribute. Here’s a reflection on my journey:

Week One: A Feeling of Content

As I reached out to people, I was amazed at how persuasive I could be. I explained the mission of the Akhuwat Foundation and the impact their donations would have. To my delight, many agreed to donate and shared their donation screenshots with me. Collecting over one thousand rupees felt like a significant achievement, filling me with a sense of contentment and fulfillment. I learned that even small efforts can make a difference and that people are willing to support a good cause when they understand its importance.
The first week taught me that initiating conversations about charity is not as daunting as it seems. People are inherently generous and supportive when approached with sincerity and a clear purpose.

Week Two: Silence

In the second week, I expanded my efforts by involving friends and visiting classes in my department. Despite receiving a positive response, the funds collected did not meet my expectations. This contrast was stark compared to the previous week’s success, and it tested my patience and perseverance.
The second week was a humbling experience, reminding me that not every effort yields immediate results. It highlighted the importance of consistency and the need to stay motivated, even when faced with slower progress.

Challenges and Resilience

Throughout this journey, I encountered numerous challenges — from rejections and apathy to time constraints and logistical issues. However, each setback only strengthened my resolve. I learned to adapt, innovate, and find creative solutions to keep pushing forward.

This experience has been instrumental in building my resilience. It taught me the importance of perseverance and the power of resilience in achieving goals. Every obstacle became a stepping stone, reinforcing my belief in the cause and my determination to succeed.

items.title: Mastering Productivity with the Pomodoro Technique
items.author: Tufail Ahmad
items.description:
I embarked on the task of preparing for my clinical case presentation in clinical Pharmacy class using the Pomodoro Technique. The Pomodoro Technique is a time management method that breaks work into intervals, traditionally 25 minutes in length, separated by short breaks.

Challenges and Learnings: Initially, maintaining focus posed a significant challenge. My mind struggled to stay on task, constantly lured by distractions. However, as I persisted with the Pomodoro Technique, I began noticing improvements. The structured intervals helped me stay accountable and disciplined. I learned to recognize distractions, jot them down, and quickly refocus on the task at hand.

Another challenge I faced was managing my energy levels throughout the sessions. While the 25-minute intervals were effective for maintaining focus, I found myself feeling fatigued towards the end of longer study sessions. Taking short breaks helped alleviate this issue, allowing me to recharge and approach each Pomodoro session with renewed energy.

Implications for Future Learning and Steps of Improvement: Reflecting on my experience, I recognize the potential of the Pomodoro Technique to enhance my future learning endeavors. To further improve my productivity using this method, I plan to:

  1. Optimize my work environment: Creating a designated study space free from distractions will help me stay focused during Pomodoro sessions.
  2. Prioritize tasks: Breaking down larger tasks into smaller, manageable segments will make them less overwhelming and more conducive to the Pomodoro Technique.
  3. Experiment with break activities: Exploring different activities during short breaks, such as stretching or mindfulness exercises, can help me recharge more effectively.
  4. Track progress: Keeping a record of completed Pomodoro sessions and reflecting on my productivity levels will enable me to identify patterns and areas for improvement.

By implementing these steps, I aim to maximize the effectiveness of the Pomodoro Technique in my future learning endeavors. With dedication and practice, I am confident that I can harness its full potential to achieve greater productivity and success.

items.title: From the Heart: A Journey of Thankfulness
items.author: Tufail Ahmad
items.description:
In our busy world, pausing and appreciating those who matter is vital. It reminds us of the blessings we often overlook in the rush of daily life and fosters a deeper sense of connection and appreciation. By expressing gratitude, we strengthen our relationships and cultivate a sense of appreciation for the blessings we often take for granted. It’s a reminder of the interconnectedness of our lives and the importance of showing kindness and gratitude.

The roots of all goodness lie in the soil of appreciation for goodness. — Dalai Lama

In essence, the letter-giving experience was a beautiful reminder of the profound bond I share with my Mom and dear friend. It strengthened our connection and deepened my appreciation for the love and support they consistently offer me. Moving forward, I am committed to expressing my gratitude to them through letters, words, and my daily actions.

items.title: A Journey from Lower Dir to Swabi: To the Land of Wisdom and Hospitality
items.author: Tufail Ahmad
items.description:
As I was returning to my hostel after Eid vacation, I kept an eye out for interesting sights to capture with my camera. Despite being in a crowded bus or a shared taxi, I was still focused on getting back to my hostel on time and completing my daily tasks.

This time, I decided to view my journey through a different lens — the lens of a camera. Capturing snippets of my journey, I uncovered a tapestry of stories woven into the fabric of our city.

As I looked through the pictures, I couldn't help but notice the obstacles that dotted the path of my fellow travelers. Every image portrayed a different aspect of our collective journey, from the limited transportation options in remote villages to the inadequate facilities at the Chakdara interchange.

Gaps:

  1. The struggle for transportation begins at the grassroots level, where villagers face hurdles in reaching areas with public transport access.

2. The Chakdara interchange is a busy area, but it does not have enough facilities for tired travelers. This shows that there is a need for better infrastructure and amenities.

2. The garbage near our university shows that we need to be more aware of the environment and manage waste better.

Aspects I’d like to change:

  1. I recognize the importance of exploring different routes to gain a broader perspective of our city’s landscape and its challenges.
  2. Ensuring safety measures for all, including adhering to seatbelt usage during travel, is a commitment I pledge to uphold.

Thank you for accompanying me on this insightful exploration of our shared paths.

items.title: Aiming Higher: My Journey to Academic Excellence in Pharmacy Studies #juststart
items.author: Tufail Ahmad
items.description:
As we chase our dreams, there comes a moment of realization when we understand the significance of setting goals and working towards them with unwavering determination. This realization dawned upon me when I resolved to pursue excellence in my pharmacy studies.

As a final-year PharmD student, I currently have an aggregate mark of 69%. However, I believe that I have the potential to do better. Therefore, I have set a SMART goal for myself, which is to increase my aggregate marks to at least 72% by the end of this academic year.

Setting this goal was just the beginning of my journey. The real challenge lay in taking consistent action to turn my aspirations into reality. With this in mind, I outlined a plan that would guide me toward success.

To make sure that I didn't miss any classes, the first step was attending every lecture and seminar. It became a non-negotiable part of my routine. By actively participating in class discussions and engaging with course material, I was able to deepen my understanding of key concepts and stay on top of my studies.

But simply attending classes wasn’t enough. I knew I needed to go above and beyond to achieve my goal. That’s why I decided to challenge myself by making presentations. These presentations not only helped me revise important topics but also allowed me to hone my communication and presentation skills.

I realized the importance of collaboration and support from peers in addition to individual efforts. As a result, I began discussing course material with a friend. We worked together to understand difficult concepts, clear up uncertainties, and exchange studying methods. These conversations provided me with fresh perspectives and insights that enhanced my learning experience.

As I look back on my academic journey, I feel proud of the progress I have made towards achieving my goals. Every day presents new challenges and opportunities for growth, and I am committed to confronting them with enthusiasm and determination.

As I look to the future, I am aware that there will be challenges to overcome and setbacks to navigate. However, with a clear vision, a solid plan, and unwavering determination, I am confident that I will accomplish my goal of raising my overall grades to 72% by the end of this academic year.

I believe that my academic journey is not solely about obtaining a particular grade. Instead, it's about testing my limits, exploring my potential, and developing myself to become the finest version of myself. As I progress on this path, I am thrilled to see where it leads me and the individual I will evolve into.
